TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ToolStripSplitButton extends System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDownItem

Docs.summary: Represents a combination of a standard button on the left and a drop-down button on the right, or the other way around if the value of is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks ToolStripSplitButton combines button and drop-down button functionality.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton.DefaultItem%2A> property to synchronize the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Click> event of the chosen drop-down item with the item shown on the button.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For more information about handling events, see [Events](../Topic/Handling%20and%20Raising%20Events.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this member. In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the ButtonClick event. This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MessageBox.Show%2A?displayProperty=fullName> with <xref:System.Console.WriteLine%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or appending the message to a multiline <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox>.
To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of type <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton> named `ToolStripSplitButton1`. Then ensure that the event handler is associated with the ButtonClick event.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#609](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/e-system.windows.forms.t_155_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#609](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/e-system.windows.forms.t_155_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance class System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripDropDown CreateDefaultDropDown() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a generic for which events can be defined.
Gets a value indicating whether to display the that is defined as the default.
Gets or sets the portion of the that is activated when the control is first selected.
Docs.value: A representing the portion of the that is activated when first selected. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton> has a DefaultItem, the ENTER key activates the button. Otherwise, the ENTER key activates the drop-down.
Use the DefaultItem property to synchronize the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Click> event of the chosen drop-down item with the item shown on the button.

Docs.returns: A representing the portion of the that is activated when first selected. The default value is .

Docs.summary: Occurs when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton.DefaultItem%2A> has changed.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For more information about handling events, see [Events](../Topic/Handling%20and%20Raising%20Events.md).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this member. In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the DefaultItemChanged event. This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MessageBox.Show%2A?displayProperty=fullName> with <xref:System.Console.WriteLine%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or appending the message to a multiline <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox>.
To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of type <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton> named `ToolStripSplitButton1`. Then ensure that the event handler is associated with the DefaultItemChanged event.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#611](../../add/codesnippet/CSharp/e-system.windows.forms.t_3_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#611](../../add/codesnippet/VisualBasic/e-system.windows.forms.t_3_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: The width, in pixels, of the drop-down button portion of a .
Docs.value: An <xref:System.Int32> representing the width in pixels. The default is 11. Starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_2015](../../add/includes/net-2015-md.md)], the default value is based on the DPI setting of the device running the app.
Docs.exception: The specified value is less than zero (0).
Docs.returns: An <xref:System.Int32> representing the width in pixels. The default is 11. Starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_2015](../../add/includes/net-2015-md.md)], the default value is based on the DPI setting of the device running the app.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnButtonClick(class System.EventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.param: An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Raises the event.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see [Events](../Topic/Handling%20and%20Raising%20Events.md).
The OnButtonClick method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void PerformButtonClick() cil managed

Docs.summary: If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.Enabled%2A> property is , calls the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton.OnButtonClick%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyorassemblyhidebysig virtual instance bool ProcessDialogKey(valuetype System.Windows.Forms.Keys keyData) cil managed

Docs.param: One of the values that represents the key to process.
Docs.summary: Processes a dialog key.
Docs.returns: if the key was processed by the item; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is called during message preprocessing to handle the ENTER and SPACEBAR keys in order to raise the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItem.Click> event. However, if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripSplitButton> is not enabled, this method calls the base class implementation instead.
This method is called only if the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.IsInputKey%2A> method indicates that the item is not processing the key.

Docs.permission: for all windows for inheriting classes to call this method. Associated enumeration: value of .
Docs.value: if the key was processed by the item; otherwise, .

Docs.param: The character to process.
Docs.summary: Processes a mnemonic character.
